guidelines.prose: the frequency at which inactive accounts must be disabled;
the timeframe in which accounts no longer required must be notified;
the timeframe in which users who are terminated or transferred must be notified;
the timeframe in which system usage or the need-to-know changes for an individual must be notified;

parts.name: item
parts.prose: Require that users log out of the system after {{ insert: param, bd87b4e7-22de-4998-9897-e4ef6143cc98 }} of expected inactivity or when {{ insert: param, 3ef0be11-5407-445b-8945-7d2ac4575c99 }}.

parts.name: guidance
parts.prose:
This requirement focuses on account management for systems and applications. The definition and enforcement of access authorizations other than those determined by account type (e.g., privileged access, non-privileged access) are addressed in 03.01.02. System account types include individual, group, temporary, system, guest, anonymous, emergency, developer, and service. Users who require administrative privileges on system accounts receive additional scrutiny by personnel responsible for approving such accounts and privileged access. Types of accounts that organizations may prohibit due to increased risk include group, emergency, guest, anonymous, and temporary.

Organizations may choose to define access privileges or other attributes by account, type of account, or a combination of both. Other attributes required for authorizing access include restrictions on the time of day, day of the week, and point of origin. When defining other system account attributes, organizations consider system requirements (e.g., system upgrades, scheduled maintenance) and mission and business requirements (e.g., time zone differences, remote access to facilitate travel requirements).

Users who pose a significant security risk include individuals for whom reliable evidence indicates either the intention to use authorized access to the system to cause harm or that adversaries will cause harm through them. Close coordination among mission and business owners, system administrators, human resource managers, and legal staff is essential when disabling system accounts for high-risk individuals. Time periods for the notification of organizational personnel or roles may vary. Inactivity logout is behavior- or policy-based and requires users to take physical action to log out when they are expecting inactivity longer than the defined period. Automatic enforcement of inactivity logout is addressed by 03.01.10.

parts.name: objective
parts.prose: The organization manages information system accounts, including establishing, activating, modifying, reviewing, disabling, and removing accounts.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: The time period for account inactivity before disabling is defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: The time period within which to notify account managers and designated personnel or roles when accounts are no longer required is defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: The time period within which to notify account managers and designated personnel or roles when users are terminated or transferred is defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: The time period within which to notify account managers and designated personnel or roles when system usage or the need-to-know changes for an individual is defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: The time period of expected inactivity requiring users to log out of the system is defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Circumstances requiring users to log out of the system are defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System account types allowed are defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System account types prohibited are defined.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are created in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are enabled in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are modified in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are disabled in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are removed in accordance with organizational policy, procedures, prerequisites, and criteria.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Authorized users of the system are specified.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Group and role memberships are specified.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Access authorizations (i.e., privileges) for each account are specified.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Access to the system is authorized based on a valid access authorization.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Access to the system is authorized based on intended system usage.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Access to the system is authorized based on intended system usage.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are disabled when the accounts have expired.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are disabled when the accounts have been inactive for {{ insert: param, 11111718-b2d6-41ba-82c4-42bf2ac62442 }}

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are disabled when the accounts are no longer associated with a user or individual.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are disabled when the accounts violate organizational policy.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: System accounts are disabled when significant risks associated with individuals are discovered.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Account managers and designated personnel or roles are notified within {{ insert: param, 8614c61c-f2c4-474c-b6cf-04e9bc321900 }} when accounts are no longer required.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Account managers and designated personnel or roles are notified within {{ insert: param, 0612baf7-8c8c-48a4-8fa6-a8d39889f852 }} when users are terminated or transferred.

parts.name: sub-objective
parts.prose: Users are required to log out of the system after {{ insert: param, bd87b4e7-22de-4998-9897-e4ef6143cc98 }} of expected inactivity or when the following circumstances occur: {{ insert: param, 3ef0be11-5407-445b-8945-7d2ac4575c99 }}.

parts.name: assessment-objects

props.name: object-option
props.value: personnel termination or transfer policies and procedures

props.name: object-option
props.value: list of active system accounts and the name of the individual associated with each account

props.name: object-option
props.value: list of conditions for group and role membership

props.name: object-option
props.value: notifications of recent transfers, separations, or terminations of employees

props.name: object-option
props.value: list of recently disabled system accounts and the name of the individual associated with each account

props.name: object-option
props.value: list of user activities that pose significant organizational risks

props.name: object-option
props.value: system-generated list of emergency accounts disabled

parts.prose:
EXAMINE: Select one or more documents or records to examine based on system implementation and assessment scope.
[SELECT FROM: access control policy and procedures; personnel termination or transfer policies and procedures; procedures for account management; list of active system accounts and the name of the individual associated with each account; system design documentation; list of conditions for group and role membership; system configuration settings; notifications of recent transfers, separations, or terminations of employees; list of recently disabled system accounts and the name of the individual associated with each account; list of user activities that pose significant organizational risks; access authorization records; account management compliance reviews; system monitoring and audit records; system security plan; system-generated list of accounts removed; system-generated list of emergency accounts disabled; system-generated list of disabled accounts; other relevant documents and records]

parts.name: assessment-objects
parts.prose:
INTERVIEW: Select one or more personnel types to interview based on system implementation.
SELECT FROM: personnel with account management responsibilities; system administrators; personnel with information security responsibilities; system developers]

parts.name: assessment-objects
parts.prose:
TEST: Select one or more options based on system implementation.
[SELECT FROM: processes for account management on the system; mechanisms for implementing account management]
